name: The Witchery by the Castle

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My fiancee and I stayed in the Sempill Suite for a birthday celebration. The other reviews here are spot on re the luxury of the place, the attention to detail and the sumptuousness of the rooms. I haven't stayed anywhere that compares to it. This is a restaurant with rooms rather than a 5-star hotel so I don't know if they can deliver toothpaste or launder shirts at 4am, but the service we got was excellent. Getting the breakfast served in the room was a nice touch, it arrived bang on time. Given a completely free choice I'd prefer a fry-up to the continental version but when the time comes you won't want to leave that suite to get it! It is worth arriving early and checking out late, none of which seems to present much of a problem to the very helpful staff.
reviews.title: Quite wonderful.......

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the practicalities, you need to book a suite for a Saturday night several months in advance - there are only 7 of them. You should also note that the rooms are located in a mediaeval town centre so there isn't a car park outside. The best thing to do is use the NCP at Castle Terrace and walk or cab it up the hill. Being right next to Edinburgh Castle, it's also in the middle of a main tourist and events thoroughfare so while the rooms are delightful and tranquil (the odd creaky floorboard excepted), it is a city centre rather than a rural hideaway.
reviews.title: a fantastic place to stay!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had dinner in the Secret Garden. The setting is beautiful, the service was attentive and friendly without being overbearing and the food was lovely. The wine list is impressive. In fairness, you can almost certainly get better value for money elsewhere (the food is not head-and-shoulders above other Edinburgh offerings in the way that the setting and atmosphere is) but for a romantic night away with a nice meal I don't think you could do better. Really quite special.
reviews.title: fantasic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: went here for a Romantic stay, it was fabulous, every detail was just
reviews.title: If you want to be treated like a King (or Queen!!) This is the place for you

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the best! staff excellent, felt really special, breakfast was wonderful too, the staff lit every candle for us. Romance xxxxxxx saving to go back!!
reviews.title: A Perfect Honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: hum..... just got back from the witchery.
reviews.title: not the sempill

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: first night in the libary just fabulous, lovely touch with the champers and cookies and the most fun bathroom ever. v romantic, dusty but quirky, nice and peaceful. magical for 1 night only. 2 ndnight in the sempill was absoloutely dreadful. the bedroom is pleasant enough but was very dirty particularly the drapes around the bed, but the batroom was sooooooo tacky and dated, one of the walls was made of metal(!) and every time you open the door or anything the whole room shook like a tin can, the wallpaer was cheap and nasty and torn in places, the mirror above the bath was cracked and the drapes mouldy. all night someone was moving around above us . VERY NOISY,the next morning we asked to be moved back to the libary or another suite but they were fully booked, we thought grin and bear it maybe just an especially noisy person above.... however the next eveing was just as bad and no hot water at all. i was so mad i got out of my cold bath and went over in tears to the reception where i was told we had been given the option already to go to prestonfield which was not true, apparently there 'cant be a problem with the hot water' and we were to be given no special treatment for this. for 295 a night i expect a hot bath a clean room and peace. they really should try and sound proof a bit.... certainly didnt help having a metal wall! the secret garden is beautiful, food average. staff very friendly bar the head honcho who clearly was in no mood to help. oh i forgot when we left they tried to vharge us someones massive meal bill when we had paid ours already. not great. dissapointed with night 2 and 3 , loved night 1. verdict dont stay in sempill, stay in libary but 1 night only this is a novelty hotel and will wear thin after 1 night. eat at the blue maison in victoria street.
reviews.title: wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Myself and my fiance stayed in The Witchery on the 17th November this year, after having dinner there in august, i had read all the reviews and was quite excited to stay there.
reviews.title: Enjoy the romantic & quirky rooms - eat elsewhere !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at the hotel a little early where they took our case off us and asked us to come back at 3 o'clock to ensure our room was ready.
reviews.title: Amazing

likes.liked: — Absolutely all of it. Can't chose.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We came back and where showed to out toom by roxy, the room we had booked was the armoury, it was amazing, i actually can not describe how beautiful it was, oak panels, heated floors, the whole works.
reviews.title: Spellbinding

likes.liked: — Location, decor, ambience, staff, food... where do I stop?
likes.disliked: — The light switches are confusing, to say the least!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here on Jan 3rd for our 19th wedding anniversary. We stayed in the 'Guardroom, which was fantastic , very dark, gothic and romantic. It is definately somewhere i would stay again . The breakfast next morning was excellant and it was nice to have it at your leisure in the room. It was very windy and wet the evening we stayed so the bedroom was a bit noisy but it was weather related rather than noise from the street or hotel. The Guardroom is right at the top at the back so it was nice and quiet until the wind got up.This is a hotel i would like to come back to despite living just over the bridge it was a very romantic and unusual experience, and the champagne and chocolates were fab
reviews.title: excellant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Second time we've stayed, and this time a totally different experience with the type of room. It was a wet, dark day when we arrived, but the staff were really helpful and took us over the road to one of the suites which is situated a few yards down from the main hotel. Previously, we'd stayed in the room above the restaurant which had been fantastic, but thought we'd try another!
reviews.title: Big birthday celebration...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was the Guardsroom suite, and as we walked in it was warm, relaxing and great music playing. As usual, very over the top with the scenery - which is why you go there! The bathroom was amazing, although husband found the shower over the bath a little difficult to negotiate as the curtain kept getting stuck! I just sank into the actual bath which was wonderful.
reviews.title: A Night in The Vestry

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'd booked the Enchanted Garden for dinner, and had arranged as a suprise for my husbands brother and wife to join us. This had been booked six months previously, and the hotel staff sworn to secrecy. It all went according to plan (even though their flight was delayed by an hour!) and the staff brought them over to our suite - my husbands face when he opened the door was amazing! He was totally speechless.
reviews.title: Wondeful, peaceful and romantic - the perfect honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After sinking a couple of bottles of bubbly in the sitting area, we walked over for dinner - restaurant was amazing, and food fantastic.
reviews.title: Not worth the money

likes.liked: — Its a great location and very atmospheric
likes.disliked: — Extremely suspicous white stains on the blankets...... No hot water.....Cold food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Sempill Suite for two nights to celebrate my 30th birthday and our 9th wedding anniversary. The suite was gorgeous and the bathroom and bedroom were both enormous. We also had a reception room, kitchen, sitting room and long hallway leading to the bedroom. The best bits were the champagne (you get a bottle for each night of your stay - plus fresh choccie truffles and cookies!), the massive roll rop bath and the breakfast. The breakfast it bought to your room each day in a large open whicker basket - you choose what you want the night before and hang your selection on your door ready to be collected. You can choose the time you want it delivered (upto 10:30 am) and whether you want it unpacking or not. The food supplied on both mornings was delicious (especially the bowl of porridge which could have easily fed two people!), and the two croissants and two pan au chocolat were lovely and fresh. We also actually got five cups of coffee from the pot they gave us! They definately give you enough breakfast to feed an army and you could get by perfectly without having any lunch! The only downside to the whole experience was that on the last night, the people in the suite upstairs were moving around and being noisy ALL night (and you can hear everything). I managed to get two hours sleep just before it was time to get up! However, all in all it was a great experience and definately recommended for a special occasion.
reviews.title: Absolutely Brilliant!

likes.liked: — Very gothic and romantic. The breakfast. The champers.
likes.disliked: — The noise on the second night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here as a surprise for my husband's 40th birthday and it was just wonderful. Worth every penny, and no downsides at all. We were in the armoury suite and loved the 4 poster bed, the tv that comes out of the ottoman and all the little extras. Many thanks to the staff for this amazing experiance, can't wait for the next special occasion to go celebrate here again.
reviews.title: loved this place

likes.liked: — the location, the decadance, the uniqueness of the hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A trip to Edinburgh would not be complete without a trip to the Witchery! The Witchery truly delivered, and the shining star, and complete credit to the establishment is the magnificent Roxy! If you miss the pleasure of meeting Roxy, you simply must go back! The room (Guard Room) was everything we expected, and then some...I'm sure you've read about the Pol Roger, decadent cookies, truffles, and little gold box of what I think was traditional tablet wrapped with a lovely tartan ribbon on the bed. The thoughtfulness put into the Witchery is indescribable. The location simply can't be beat, and you must experience the Witchery at least once in your lifetime! The only disappointment was the 3:00 a.m. ghost that did not make his presence known to us. Roxy, I wish I was your sister from Sligo, she is truly one lucky girl.... Thanks for everything!
reviews.title: amazing experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were looking for a romantic, different setting for an anniversary weekend.... and found it in the Witchery.
reviews.title: An unbelievable experience !!!

likes.liked: — The experience - it is something that you need to experience once in a lifetime
likes.disliked: — Lightening dim but you could not make it brighter (suppose that has to do with the theatrics of it ) Toiletries - for the bath shower they were attached to a wall about arms length from the bath !!! Bit strange given the price you were paying for the room !! And parking - the nearest is about 1/2 a mile down the road and it is a long journey up the hill to get to there. Would advise taking a taxi !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Guardsroom and to say it was overwhelming is/was an understatement. From the entrance to the bedroom this is one experience that you don't want to miss. The room was fantastic and I think the word k theatrical would do it justice. From the kitchen to the bathroom and to the room that you are served your breakfast in - unbelievable !!! Value for money, maybe not but value for experience - you could probably not beat it. Like previous comments I found the Witchery resturant expensive and could not say I got value for money. Having said that there are plenty of resturants nearby at a fraction of the price with as good a selection so you would be doing yourself an injustice not to have a look around (Du Pres and the wee windaes both on the Royal mile spring to mind). This is not a place for families although there is plenty of room for more than 2 !!!! But more of an experience and as such if that is what you are expecting you will not be disappointed.
reviews.title: No where better!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As an Anniversary gift, I took my wife to stay in the fabulous Witchery. I'd always heard lots of praise for the Witchery and if it's good enough for the Hollywood stars it's good enough for me.
reviews.title: MEGA!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At reception we were greeted by a very nice gentleman who took our bags and escorted us a short walk across the cobbled street on the Royal Mile to our suite.
reviews.title: Fantastic, like a dream, So Romantic!

likes.disliked: — Having to leave at the end!!

reviews.title: A wonderful experience
reviews.text: First impressions were...WOW! I've never seen a suite like this before. Kitchen, dining area, large bathroom with roll top bath and a very spacious bedroom with four-poster bed. The suite was very cosy, dark with a wonderful gothic theme. We had actually planned to spend a day shopping but the suite was so fab that we just stayed in and enjoyed the bottle of Champagne that was on ice....not forgetting the cookies!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: That evening we had booked the Secret Garden which was very romantic. Food/service was excellent and I felt the prices were fair. A three course dinner and drinks for 2 came to about £100.
reviews.title: Can`t wait to go back

likes.liked: — The completely different atmosphere that is created

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast (pancakes, croissants, juice, toast etc) was delivered in a picnic basket along with the daily papers. Very nice.
reviews.title: Its an experience....but not a hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Stayed for one night in the Guardroom. Staff were great, welcoming and attentive, the food in the restaurant excellent, the chilean white wine we had was the best ever. There was also a fully equipped kitchen if you wanted to stay in to eat.
reviews.title: Fantastic - expensive but worth it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loved the Guardroom, 5 rooms in all, the cds and dvds in the room were a nice idea, we loved the tv rising up from the foot of the bed at the touch of a button and the fresh white lillies were beautiful. Molton Brown toiletries in the bathroom were another touch of luxury. Didn't feel at all spooky as some have suggested just opulent and theatrical.
reviews.title: Fantastic!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was delicious and we didn't want to leave the room.
reviews.title: One night honeymoon

likes.disliked: — That I could only afford one night!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everyone should try and stay here once in their life. A magical experience.
reviews.title: Wonderful, just wonderful!

likes.disliked: — kitchen was a bit out of keeping with the gothic style, no hot water in morning!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Preston, Lancashire
reviews.title: Stunning, just stunning.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Inner Sanctum for one night to celebrate our honeymoon in lavish over the top surrounds. We got what we were looking for! The Witchery was so much fun, we're now determined to become ridiculously wealthy and work out some sort of permanent lease program with the hotel/restaurant.
reviews.title: Such a great time; our bad for taking the key

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The snacks, champagne upon arrival, room, and bathroom were all fantastic.
reviews.title: Wow.....Wow.....Wow!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a wonderful dinner at the Witchery restaurant. The food was delicious, our waiters were all charmingly Scottish young men, and we could not have been happier. The seafood in Scotland is so fantastic! I think I'm permanently spoilt from having it in such great quantities.
reviews.title: If you have to ask this is not the sanctuary for you!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One night, for us, was perfect. We got to enjoy the experience without going broke. The staff was stupendous, the breakfast brought to our room was so wonderful. All in all, it made for a very relaxing, romantic stay.
reviews.title: The Witchery is amazing but beware of the restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was fun reading the guest book in our room -- there were so many cute couple stories! A lot of honeymoons and anniversaries.
reviews.title: Truly magnificent!
Most romantic place in UK
reviews.text: We stayed in The Guardroom Suite on 6th September as a 1st wedding anniversary celebration.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our Suite was amazing- had 5 rooms and was just gorgeous. So romantic and everything was perfect.
reviews.title: Extremely disappointing stay and suprisingly terrible food
A gothic fantasy-fest!
reviews.text: We ate in The Secret Garden restauarnt and it was fabulous.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place definitely lives up to its hype and we can't wait to go back again!
reviews.title: Awesome

likes.liked: — Gothic romantic atmosphere and the champagne!
likes.disliked: — Upstairs creaky floorboards, but I'm being picky!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: After having eaten a wonderful meal at The Witchery 3 years ago, we booked to stay for our second wedding anniversary for two nights in the Armoury suite, with dinner at the Secret Garden.
reviews.title: Amazing!!!

aka: The Witchery By The Castle Hotel
